world on the occasion of Chu Soc festival, also known as the
Korean Mid-Autumn Festival.  National
authorities organized a
special art performance honoring the traditional folk art of
samori, samori is the music of
Korean farmers, it originates from
community rituals and entertains the audience.
Blessings and prayers for a good
harvest. Nowadays, agricultural music is also
performed as a
professional entertainment art form. Since 2014,
Samun Nori has been recognized by Unesco as an
intangible cultural heritage of humanity.
Samun nori is a form of dance performance
that combines the music and rhythm of four
musical instruments, including large and small fried sheep and two
traditional Samoni drums, expressing a unique art that
recreates the ancient farming life
of the people.  Korea, with its
strong rhythm, fast body movements and
energetic costumes when performing,
these characteristics have made samun
special in everyone's eyes.
Currently, samoni is well received not only in
Korea but also abroad.  Many other countries around the
world, from old pencils, a
Japanese artist has revived them into
impressive sculptures
with creative design and meticulousness in
creating the sculptures.
This is creating a craze on
social networks. The part that sushi Hirata uses to
create images is the tip of a pencil. The subject of
his creations is very diverse, from writing objects
to fictional characters. Pencils are often
thrown away.  when preparing to sharpen many times
and become short. Even though
these old pencils are useless to everyone,
I see that they still have a
certain role in life that we
can take advantage of to create.  In
his works, Mr. Hirata uses
very primitive tools. It usually takes him about 6
hours to complete a work to make the
works more attractive. He often
polishes them after shaping them, Mr. Hirata
said he  is very interested in
reviving old objects into works of
art because this gives
himself as well as people
around him a new perspective on the value of
very ordinary things and
